alert.note: Alert for Lee (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 1:52PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Claiborne, north central Knox, northwestern Hancock, Union, northwestern Grainger and southwestern Lee Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 152 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Plainview, or 9 miles southwest of Maynardville, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Maynardville, New Tazewell, Tazewell, Plainview, Harrogate, Halls, Luttrell, Springdale and Lone Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
